Gortahork is a lively Gaeltacht village, where the Irish language is the main language of the area. Along with Falcarragh, it forms part of the district known as Cloughaneely.
Coach Tours, Service From Gortahork to Letterkenny daily
Gort a' Choirce has been home to the
Documentary Film Festival since 2006. The festival runs in May, and in its first year screened 30 films from 15 different countries.
The restaurant has a good reputation.
Teach Bhillie, well known for great pints of Guinness and one of the best traditional music sessions around, every Tuesday night.
is a 39 en-suite bedroom hotel. It is named after Loch Altan, a lake situated at the foot of the northern slopes of nearby Mount Errigal.
